\text{Find the result of the following matrix addition}\\ \left[\begin{array}{cc} {\cos}^2 x & {\sin}^2 x \\ {\sin}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x \end{array} \right] +
\left[\begin{array}{cc} {\sin}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x \\ {\cos}^2 x & {\sin}^2 x \end{array} \right]

step.context: \text{Under what condition, the sum of two matrices}\\ A_{m \times n} \text{ and } B_{p \times q} \text{ is defined?}
step.tex: \text{When both matrices have the same order i.e.}\\ m = p \text{ and } n = q

\text{When both matrices have the same number}\\ \text{of elements i.e. }\quad
m \times n = p \times q

step.context: \text{If S = $A_{m \times n} + B_{ m \times n} $ then, what is the}\\ \text{order of resultant matrix S?}

\text{Find the result of the following matrix addition}\\ \left[\begin{array}{cc} {\cos}^2 x & {\sin}^2 x \\ {\sin}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x \end{array} \right] +
\left[\begin{array}{cc} {\sin}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x \\ {\cos}^2 x & {\sin}^2 x \end{array} \right]
step.tex:
\left[\begin{array}{cc} {\cos}^2 x + {\sin}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x + {\sin}^2 x \\ {\sin}^2 x + {\cos}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x + {\sin}^2 x \end{array} \right] \\
=
\left[\begin{array}{cc} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 \end{array} \right]
(\text{Using identity, {\cos}^2 x + {\sin}^x = 1)

\left[\begin{array}{cc} {\cos}^2 x + {\cos}^2 x & {\sin}^2 x + {\sin}^2 x \\ {\sin}^2 x + {\sin}^2 x & {\cos}^2 x + {\cos}^2 x \end{array} \right] \\
= \left[\begin{array}{cc} 2{\cos}^2 x & 2{\sin}^2 x \\ 2{\sin}^2 x & 2{\cos}^2 x \end{array} \right]
